meanings.definition: Take (a position of power or importance) illegally or by force.
meanings.sent1: The villain usurps the throne from the rightful king.
meanings.sent2: The dictator usurps control of the country through deceit.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky cat usurps the warm spot on the couch when no one is looking.
meanings.sent4: The new manager usurps authority from the experienced team leader.
meanings.sent5: The ambitious student usurps the top position in the class with hard work and dedication.

meanings.definition: Seize (a throne, power, etc.) without legal right.
meanings.sent1: The rebel leader usurps the crown and declares himself king.
meanings.sent2: The invader seeks to usurp control of the kingdom from its rightful ruler.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tries to usurp the bird's nest for its own use.
meanings.sent4: The rising star in politics aims to usurp power from the established politicians.
meanings.sent5: The cunning fox manages to usurp the role of leader within the pack through clever tactics.
